title: I think they should revert GA
body: It used to be an item that had trade offs to buy it. The passive and defense stats were traded for a non offensive item. Now, it's pretty pointless to get on an AP champ, and gives AD so there isn't really a trade off for champs like Yas, Riven, Yi, etc to buy it.

I'm not opposed to that either. I'd much rather have the old abyssal sceptor as an AP/MR item than the new banshee's.
old abyssal was pure cancer item and everyone outside of kata mains should be glad it's gone
What about {{item:3001}} ? Mages lost this item in favour of Banshee's. I don't say all items should be reverted, but a solid AP + MR item should exist imo.
Nobody buys this anymore except for Ornn... Failed item from a failed balance team (not blaming the designer here, the balance team ruined it)
I don't want AP champs taking both broken stopwatch items.
Then make the effects Unique where any item with Stopwatch built in cannot be stacked. Solves the issue right there. They did it with Tear.
So what, if you hourglass then GA's passive just turns off? One's an active and the other is a passive so I'm not sure if it'd work in any other way.
That's the point. It forces you to pick one.
Right. Like, I get that sounds shitty, but its kinda the only way that would work lol
Less shitty and more awkward but it probably would work.

Then we just go back to the days of tanks being the only ones to take this item and getting the absolute most benefit with little-to-no trade-off while the current item is an _actual_ tradeoff for most characters due to the item's stats being hardcoded to raw AD/armor, both of which set back the intended roll (carries) while being an occasionally good item on divers/skirmishers/etc.

They changed it because it was just a free second life for 4K HP tanks to respawn instantly.

I'm glad that form of the item is long gone.

Which could have been resolved with an upper cap of revive health, like 1000. Even then 4000 health is hyperbole since the item itself grants none. The only characters reaching 4000 health without 5 health items (6 minus {{item:1001}} ) are {{champion:31}} and {{champion:14}}

I wonder if you even played back in the GA Tank meta. It wasn't fun, it wasn't fair, and thank god it was changed.
Tanks used to be able to walk into three or more people, kill a mage with their Sunfire by standing next to them, then revive and do it all over again.

Do you remember why people didn't play bruisers for the longest time? Because tanks could take 3 times the punishment while dealing as much damage as the bruisers. GA enabled a lot of that, giving a free extra life on top of the large sustainability that MR/Armor+HP provide.

Even if it's just 3000 HP, the item gave 60 armor and 45 MR plus 30% max HP upon revival, and stats piled on top of a large HP pool go a long way and you wanna add a revive on top of that??

If you go back to the {{item:1031}} {{item:1057}} build, then what is an ADC supposed to build against assassins? Just waste a spot for a fully defensive item that doesn't even work as well since they don't even build that much HP? And if you're gonna reply to this you'll need to give me more than the usual _"REEEEEEEEE ADC OP REEEEEEE"_ stuff a lot of people do in these boards. And no, PD is just not enough in some games.

Building anything defensive as a carry feels horrible, but in this one-shot meta is necessary. Slow down the entire damage creep of the game and then maybe the item isn't even necessary anymore.

But a free second life for tanks for 2400 Gold? Glad that crap is gone forever.
I remember. Those were the dark days.
Because you'd rather have Kench or ChoGath buying GA and having multiple 9900HP healthbars
Yeah, I would actually.
You say that now but you don't seem to remember having to kill tanks twice. Or three times if they were Zac. No. that never needs to happen ever again.
But Cho does the no damages unless building full AP. So I'd rather than than have to kill every AD nukes assassin yasuo twice.

Uhh…… What? Cho's ult is literally true damage that scales off his health and is point and click. And grants him more health so it can do more damage the next time. That's not no damage. That's a lot of damage that's *not* counterable because its Health Scaling, % health True damage. There are literal videos of Cho'gath just walking up and eating full health squishies.

It is counterable though.  It is flat damage on an immobile champion that scales with his own health.
If Cho's ult says it deals 400 true damage, it is going to deal that 400 true damage (minus something like coup de grace?).
You can build flat health, tenacity, mitigation, and sustain to counter it.
Cho wants to use it as an execute for stacks (most of the time), delaying that is basically crippling Cho's AoE damage.
It isn't like Elise's Qs, feast's damage doesn't scale off of the enemy's health.
It isn't like Pyke or Urgot where it just ignores shields, those still mitigate Feast's damage.
The range of feast is also melee range on someone who is extremely slow and telegraphed.

Advocate for Feast going back to magic damage, sure.
But not counterable?
That makes less sense than the view that Darius is strong at all points in the game.

It literally isn't counterable. What ADC can afford to build health just to avoid getting one shot by a cho'gath? What item will fit neatly into an ADCs build that will provide health enough to prevent a chogath from 1 shotting them with a true damage ult.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E9MxM2NmH5g What counter play! Getting flashed on as a squishy who can't build health and having 1 button pushed on you. 

No, Cho'gath especially does not need the ability to build GA and he most definitely does plenty of damage.

That's a montage by Vandiril, might as well be going to smurfing channels to recommend builds to you.
Feast can also only 1-shot ADCs in VERY specific situations.
9+ feast stacks, gargoyles + protobelt, flash often needing to be used, this is pretty far into the game and is being signaled long before it happens.
In the video it is constantly showing Cho with 3 or 4 completed items whilst his enemies only have 1 or 2 + components.

A Cho' 1 shotting the ADC is incredibly telegraphed, it isn't like Rengar where you hear something and wait to be combo'd in <.5s
(after vision nerfs there just is no reasonable way to deal w/ it, even knowing it is coming)

In any ordinary situation Cho needs to hit his Q, which has a .625s delay, then also has orbs flying out from protobelt, likely has to do 1 AA and a feral scream before he can hit R to feast.
This gives your team a reasonable amount of time to react.

ADCs have their shielders, healers, peelers, etc.. to help them out.
Absent that, Bloodthirster, Phantom Dancer, GA, Ruined King, Mercurial (for slow and silence), Edge of Night (Q and E), Mallet, and zeal +ms items all help against Cho.  Many of these are very doable in ADC builds.  These were pretty much absent in the builds for the ADCs in your video.

If you want to say that Cho's feast deals too much damage for something that deals true damage, I'll agree with you.
He was the second champion I ever bought, but took me a while to pick him up again because I felt cheap dealing that much true damage.
As for saying he has no counterplay or that you can't build anything against him?
That's nonsensical.

Back when Cho was meta, in an LCK game Huni got one shot by a Cho'Gath feast so even if he didn't have other damage. With stone plate Cho deals a shit ton of damage, I don't want to have to kill a 5k titan twice ever again

so the person got outplayed?

in order to have 2000 damage as chogath, you need 5000  hp, gargoyle's stone plate (to make it 10,000) and 1000 AP....

I wouldn't call getting flash ulti'd being outplayed. There wasn't any ability to react or outplay it. He activated his items flashed in and one shotted a Taliyah before sitting and tanking all of the enemies team's skillshots as his team attacked them from behind him.
700 range is decent, but again, in order to one-shot someone, it would require a ridiculous amount of health and AP.  Also, where was that squishy carry's team?

But Cho'Gath have other abilities, that maybe doesn't Oneshot a ADC, but deal enough damage to help him Oneshot with Feast.
Q has base damage of 300 base magic damage + 100% AP Ratio. His W deals 275 base + 75% AP Ratio. And the cherry on top, E, which deals base of 22 / 34 / 46 / 58 / 70 + 30% AP + 3% + 0.5% per Feast stack (Which basically is 6%, because of maximum 6 stacks Cho'Gath gathers from minions and monsters.) of TARGETS'S MAXIMUM health, up to 3 times.

Sure, you need to hit and combo those abilities up for the effect, but it's still a damage not to be shrugged off, especially if you're squishy ADC or Mage who can be knocked up, slowed and silenced for 3-5 seconds.
AND he synnergises well with almost any AP and Tank items. 
AND you want to give old GA with tank stats to Cho'Gath, for him to have a very high chance of another rotation of spells after his revive? I must admit, you're bonkers, dude.

And I know that peel, shields and sh!t can be counters, but there's also counters to counters that counters your counters, we can talk about this for ages.

There's one fact: You don't want to kill high CC tanks twice.

his Q is also massively telegraphed, is a delayed ability, has an animation that he plays when he actually uses it...

targets he uses his W on are either already done for or are engaging against him

and his E...really, he has 125 range, which is less than his ult's range

his ult is a threat in lane, but if he is using it to stack, you can engage on him whenever he does so and punish him massively because his execute is gone

I don't think you put enough play in Cho'Gath Top, my buddy. His Q is massively telegraphed, but so is Ekko's W, Swains new W and old E (Nevermove) and other stuff are an area of effect potential CC (lesser for new Swains), which makes it also an area of denial. It's easier to close the gap between champions if you can hinder their ability to move backwards by placing a smart Q.

I didn't say much about W outside of it's damage, but I'll just say one thing: Don't underestimate 2 seconds of Silence on which you cannot flash, since in the next 1 second you might fly in the air via Q. Ofc there's always a bit of awkwardness currently with Silence bugging out sometimes (most notably with Blitz R), but still, when it works, it does wonders. And it's still 300 damage flat.

125 Range? Activating E gives him bonus 50 Attack Range and Feast stacks, outside of giving him health and size, also grant Attack Range up to 75 for 10 stacks. Also the hitbox of E's projectiles scale with size, giving him even bigger AoE on this ability.

Now about his Ult Stacking on minions... Sure, the 80s base cooldown is a problem when using Feast on minions while opponent is in the lane and opens Cho'Gath for all ins... but imagine the situation like this: You force enemy to back and you have your Feast still up and want to gain stacks. You munch a minion and shove the lane to recall to match enemy with similar gold spent and additional Feast stack. You recall, shop and go back to lane, you look at your ability bar, and "Hey! My R is back in like 30 seconds! I'll play passive and only trade for that time and then I'll think about all-in!" And you do, and you have second Feast stack. Ofc. I didn't do precise math to that, but I am sure that similar outcome of this situation is far from being farfetched, especially that Cho'Gaths these days would preferr the CDR items like Kindlegem, Glacial Shroud or even Fiendish Codex to get those sweet free Feast stacks up and running.

And then there's Transcendence, scaling CDR and the Ravenous Hunter for even more Feast CDR. One thing you can be sure when facing a good Cho, is that he somehow always has his Feast up. Cho'Gath is a monster, still weak for silver bullets or other garlic, but he is a monster.
And Cho is slow as shit so if you get ulted by him low enough to die, you probably deserved it. That's the counter play there.

His hit box and therefore his range also grows based on his size. .-. He also has a knock up and a silence and the ability to get Righteous Glory. He is *not* slow as shit. This is even ignoring the fact that *flash is a thing that exists.* There is no counter play regardless, to being hit with an unavoidable ability and literally just getting 1 shot. And you're specifically ignoring the multitude of videos of full health squish champions getting one shot by his ult. Like going from 100 to 0 health with just his single point and click ability.

And you want to have to try and kill him twice? You're delusional.

>His hit box and therefore his range

He does gain basic attack range, but not _because_ of the increased size. It's a separate mechanic tied to the stacking. And it has no effect on his ultimate range.

Similarly, other champions don't gain range when you buy Elixir of Iron or get ulted by Lulu. 

That said, the reason they made GA into an AD item was because people weren't buying it on tanks, even back when tank items were stronger than now. So it wouldn't even be an issue. 

THAT said, that means there's no reason to revert it, either.

I don't think they should revert GA. :/ make it's damage adaptive or reduce the damage but I do not want to see the return of full tank champions being able to build GA. Nothing is more frustrating than having to kill a tank *twice*. Furthermore, the way ADC builds are now, GA would literally be removed as an item for them to build ever. Its already hard enough to fit it into your build. When GA was just an Armor/MR item with a revive, ADC builds were wildly different. It wasn't uncommon to only build one zeal item and have just IE as your crit. Now, it is standard to build three crit items and then desperately try and figure out what your last two slots are going to be. Sometimes you just can't get away with a GA because the long CD means that its less safe than life steal.

I hear and agree with everything you're saying, but it all sounds like a good thing to me.

Tanks aren't tanking in this state of the game. They're dealing a ton more damage, but back in "the good ol days" tanks were durable front liners that contributed by physically blocking space and with CC, not with constant damage. Killing a tank twice meant they were doing their job even longer: tanking.

And right now, adcs(and ad fighters like Irelia) can still build both GA and lifesteal, a lot of them don't have to choose. they rez, kill an enemy, and are back to full health like nothing even happened. There should be a sacrifice given for a second life, and when they can get a full BF sword attached to their rez, the sacrifice of an item slot isn't really there. Many seasons ago, it was standard for ALL champions to buy one full defensive item because building glass cannon (All AD/all AP) was risky. Now everyone builds glass cannon and just blows up whoever is faster.

I don't think just a GA revert is enough though, I think several changes would need to be made to tank items so that Tanks are tanking again, and so that squishies aren't melting anything in range.

No, killing a tank twice meant that you died the second time because you blew all of your CD's trying to do it the first time. Killing a tank twice was a toxic mechanic that should *never* return. 

GA *should never be reverted.* It is less toxic to kill an ADC or assassin twice than it is to try and kill a tank twice.
